Store events in the circular buffer.

title: Add activity summary UI widget

Display: time range, activity count, categorized event list, quick stats. Support scrolling for longer summaries. Add visual indicator (badge/icon) on instance panes that have unseen activity.

title: Persist activity history to disk

title: make the kanban tab more pretty, add colors and have these tabs: Planning, In Progress, Review, Done
description:
Research and implement visual improvements to the kanban board UI.

Goals:
- Research existing kanban CLI tools (taskwarrior, kanban-cli, etc.) to understand best practices for terminal-based kanban UIs
- Update column structure: Planning → In Progress → Review → Done (instead of current To Do/In Progress/Done)
- Add color coding to improve visual hierarchy and readability
- Enhance overall aesthetics while maintaining usability

Implementation approach:
1. Research popular kanban CLI tools and document design patterns
2. Plan color scheme that works well in terminals
3. Update column definitions in kanban/state.rs
4. Implement styling in kanban/ui.rs
5. Test with various terminal color schemes

title: Agent Permissions Configuration

Since each provider handles permissions differently (Claude Code has 'permissions.allow', Gemini/Amp/OpenCode may have different systems), implement a generic permissions model that maps to provider-specific configurations.

title: Define generic permission model
description: Create a generic PermissionConfig struct that represents common tool/action permissions across all providers. Define PermissionType enum with common categories: FileRead, FileWrite, FileEdit, Search (Glob/Grep), Bash, WebFetch, etc. Add provider-specific permission mapping trait/interface that each provider implements to convert generic permissions to their native format.

title: Research provider-specific permission systems
description: Document how each provider handles permissions: Claude Code (permissions.allow in settings.local.json), Gemini (check .gemini/settings.json format), Amp (check .amp/settings.json), OpenCode (check .opencode plugin format). Identify commonalities and differences. Create provider_permissions.md design doc with mapping strategy for each provider.

title: Add PermissionConfig to Settings struct
description: Add permissions field to Settings struct (serde serialized). Add default permissions (all enabled by default for backwards compatibility). Create per-provider permission overrides (Option<PermissionConfig> per provider) to allow different permission sets for different providers.

title: Add Permissions subsection to Agent settings UI
description: Add SettingItem::AgentPermissions to Agent section items. Create permissions editor UI with checkboxes/toggles for each permission type. Show which permissions are enabled/disabled. Support toggling individual permissions. Group permissions by category (File Operations, Shell Access, Network, Search, etc.).

title: Implement provider-specific permission mapping
description: Add to_provider_permissions() method to PermissionConfig trait that each provider implements. Update Claude Code's generate_files to use configured permissions instead of hardcoded allow list. Implement mapping for Gemini, Amp, and OpenCode providers. Handle providers that don't support fine-grained permissions (fallback to all-or-nothing).

title: Add permission presets (Restrictive, Balanced, Permissive)
description: Create permission preset system with three levels: Restrictive (read-only, no bash, no network), Balanced (read/write/edit, limited bash, no network), Permissive (all permissions enabled). Add preset selector in UI. Allow customizing preset as starting point. Store which preset is active (if any) or 'Custom' if user modified it.

title: Test permissions with each provider
description: Verify that permission configurations correctly restrict agent capabilities for each provider. Test with actual tasks: verify denied permissions are blocked, allowed permissions work. Test preset configurations. Document any provider-specific limitations or workarounds. Update provider_permissions.md with test results.

- Any UI text mentioning worktrees
- Help text and documentation
- Status messages

Update the AI prompts in the review section to use the correct VCS command based on the user's selection:

The prompts should clearly indicate which VCS is being used and provide the appropriate command syntax.

- Commit creation
